contents: Article 2 (Definition) The meanings of terms used in these regulations are as follows. 1. Marketing assets refer to the following tangible and intangible assets of the Korea Sports Council (hereinafter referred to as *Sports Council). go. Intellectual property rights: Intellectual property registered by the Sports Council under the law for the purpose of referring to or symbolizing the Sports Council or the national team (Team Korea). Competitions: All domestic and international competitions hosted, hosted, operated, dispatched, and managed by the Sports Council (National Sports Festival, National Winter Sports Competition, National Boys Sports Competition, National Sports Festival, etc., comprehensive sports competitions, IOC, OCA, FISU, etc.) All international multi-sports competitions held by the International Sports Organization including two or more events), etc. Events: Athletes’ selection and disbanding ceremonies hosted or hosted by the Korea Sports Council, various press conferences, interviews, Olympic Movement-related events, etc. Portraits, names, images, etc. of competition/event participants (those who receive AD cards at competitions or events, such as players, coaches, referees, executives, and officials (hereinafter referred to as ‘competition/event participants’)). Facilities that the Sports Council owns or has the right to use 2. A commercial right holder is a person who has been granted the right to commercially use marketing assets exclusively or non-exclusively by paying sponsorship, royalties, broadcasting rights fees, etc. to the Sports Council in accordance with a contract with the Sports Council. It is divided into sponsorship rights holders, merchandising rights holders, broadcasting rights holders, etc. 3. Marketing agency refers to the act of the Sports Council generating revenue by acting on behalf of or supporting the marketing work of a related organization or a person who has entered into a marketing contract. 4. Related organizations refer to domestic and international sports-related organizations such as international sports organizations such as the IOC, OCA, and FISU, member sports organizations, provincial and provincial sports associations, comprehensive sports competition organizing committees, and international competition organizing committees.
